Oh boy, Counter Strike. uhhh, I recommend it? If you asked me a few months ago I'd say otherwise, but really all I needed was a break. This game has tons of content and replay value to it so you'll always come back. Tons of modes and things like that. Let me tell you from now that this game is NOT a casual game. Sure you can play casual, but if you dont devote a lot of time, you will not be good, and you will not have a good time unless playing one of the minigames. Casual servers are filled with hackers and is not the real experience, and comp is brutal. before you play any comp, please learn maps and callouts and basic gunplay, and lemme tell you, that's still not enough. I recommend starting in either casual-deathmatch games and use a shotgun because this game has very very large recoil and spread. play with the shotgun to understand maps and most importantly mechanics, after that please slow down and use smgs. this is not an easy game to start so please start slow. once you know the bare basics of map and mechanic knowledge, try comp and dont feel pressured to tell you. I had to take a year break and I came back stronger then ever. And i didn't even talk about skins. That's all I gotta say! Good luck!
